title: Thai Green Chicken and Aubergine Curry

ingredients.item: main protein or veg, prepared (see title)
mixed vegetables suited to the dish
handful fresh herbs (coriander, Thai basil, mint)

method: Heat the oil in a large pan over a medium heat. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
Add lemongrass and your curry paste or spice base. Cook for 1–2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the protein and brown lightly. Add vegetables, coconut milk, and a splash of water if needed.
Simmer until cooked through. Taste and balance with lime juice.
Cool quickly and portion for fridge or freezer. Reheat until piping hot.
swaps: Swap rice for brown rice if you prefer.
For milder heat, remove chilli seeds and use less paste.
For vegetarian versions, use tofu and soy sauce instead of fish sauce.
plating: Finish with fresh herbs and a squeeze of lime.
Serve with steamed rice or rice noodles.
notes: Batch-cook friendly. Cool quickly, refrigerate up to 3 days, or freeze up to 3 months. Uses extra virgin olive oil, coconut oil, or avocado oil only. No seed oils.
hydrationTip: Aim for 300–500 ml water with your meal, more if it is spicy.
